intro: Hieracium hemsedalicum, commonly known as the Hemsedal hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Hieracium hemsedalicum is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
